1_gear_quality_progression.question: What are the exact upgrade paths for gear quality (Common through Mythic)?

hero_gear_quality.description: Hero gear has 6 quality tiers. Quality is NOT upgraded in-place. You obtain higher quality gear from different sources (drops, shops, events). Lower quality gear is used as sacrifice material to provide Enhancement XP to the gear you keep.

tiers.name: Grey
tiers.purpose: Only used as sacrifice material for Enhancement XP

tiers.name: Green
tiers.purpose: Basic enhanceable gear, mostly used as sacrifice material

tiers.name: Blue
tiers.purpose: Mid-tier gear, used as sacrifice material or temporary equipment

tiers.name: Purple
tiers.how_to_obtain: Exploration stages (high levels), Arena shop, events
tiers.purpose: Good mid-game gear with high sacrifice value

tiers.name: Gold
tiers.how_to_obtain: Arena shop, packs, events, server milestones (~day 40)
tiers.purpose: Best obtainable base tier. Unlocks Mastery Forging. This is the tier you invest in long-term.
tiers.ascension_note: Can be ascended to Legendary (Red) tier at Enhancement 100 + Mastery 10

tiers.name: Legendary
tiers.purpose: Highest tier. Obtained only by ascending a fully maxed Gold piece.

hero_gear_quality.key_insight: You do NOT upgrade gear from Grey to Green to Blue etc. You FIND/OBTAIN gear at each quality level from different sources. Low quality gear is sacrificed into your high quality gear for Enhancement XP. The only quality 'upgrade' is ascending Gold gear to Legendary tier (a one-time promotion requiring specific milestones).
hero_gear_quality.sacrifice_mechanics: Lower quality gear can be 'fed' into higher quality gear to provide Enhancement XP. Grey=10 XP, Green=30 XP, Blue=60 XP, Purple=150 XP. Gold/Mythic gear CANNOT be sacrificed (they are consumed differently: for Mastery Forging levels 11-20 and for Ascension).

chief_gear_quality.description: Chief gear uses a COMPLETELY DIFFERENT system from hero gear. Chief gear has a single continuous tier progression (42 tiers from Green 0-star to Pink T3 3-star) where you upgrade step-by-step using materials. There is no 'find new gear' mechanic.

tier_progression_summary.purple: Tiers 7-14: Purple 0-3 stars + Purple T1 0-3 stars (34.00-54.23% bonus)
tier_progression_summary.gold: Tiers 15-26: Gold 0-3 stars + Gold T1 0-3 + Gold T2 0-3 (56.78-85.00% bonus)
tier_progression_summary.pink: Tiers 27-42: Pink 0-3 stars + Pink T1-T3 0-3 (89.25-187.00% bonus)

chief_gear_quality.upgrade_mechanism: Step-by-step material upgrades. Each tier has 4 steps (5 steps for T4 tiers). Upgrading within a tier costs less than crossing tier boundaries.
chief_gear_quality.note: The WOS_REFERENCE.md lists chief gear tiers as: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary, Mythic. This maps to: Green, Blue, Purple, Gold, Pink, (Pink T4). The detailed progression in chief_equipment_data.json shows 42 granular tiers.

2_level_requirements_and_quality_interac.question: Does gear need to be level 100 before upgrading to the next quality tier? What happens to the level when you upgrade quality?

hero_gear_answer.does_level_100_unlock_next_quality: NO for most tiers. Quality tiers are obtained as separate items, not upgraded from existing gear. The ONLY exception is Gold-to-Legendary ascension, which requires Enhancement Level 100 AND Mastery Level 10.
hero_gear_answer.what_happens_to_level_on_quality_change: NOT APPLICABLE for Grey through Gold. You don't upgrade quality in-place. You get a new piece of gear at the quality level. For the Gold-to-Legendary ASCENSION: the gear's enhancement level resets. The new Legendary piece starts fresh at Enhancement Level 0 with a new (higher) enhancement cap of 100.

enhancement_level_cap_per_quality.grey: Cannot be enhanced at all (0 levels)
enhancement_level_cap_per_quality.green: 100 (all enhanceable tiers share the same 100 cap)

hero_gear_answer.practical_note: In practice, only Gold and Legendary gear are worth enhancing to high levels. Enhancing Green/Blue/Purple gear is a waste of resources since those tiers will eventually be replaced.

chief_gear_answer.description: Chief gear does not have an enhancement level system. It uses a step-based tier progression where you spend materials to advance through 42 tiers. Each tier has 4 steps (5 for T4). There is no 'level 100' concept.
chief_gear_answer.step_system: Within each tier, there are 4 steps (step 1 through step 4). Completing step 4 advances you to the next tier. T4 tiers have 5 steps.

3_legendary_gear_specifics.question: Once gear becomes Legendary, how do levels work? Do they reset? What's the max level?

answer.level_reset: YES. When Gold/Mythic gear is ascended to Legendary, the enhancement level effectively resets. The new Legendary piece starts at Enhancement Level 0.

enhancement_xp_costs.description: Legendary gear has HIGHER XP costs per level compared to Gold gear enhancement
enhancement_xp_costs.level_1: Requires 2 Legendary Gear pieces (no XP cost - this is the ascension cost)
enhancement_xp_costs.level_20: Milestone - requires 10 Mithril + 3 Legendary Gear (no XP)
enhancement_xp_costs.level_40: Milestone - requires 20 Mithril + 5 Legendary Gear (no XP)
enhancement_xp_costs.level_60: Milestone - requires 30 Mithril + 5 Legendary Gear (no XP)
enhancement_xp_costs.level_80: Milestone - requires 40 Mithril + 10 Legendary Gear (no XP)
enhancement_xp_costs.level_100: Milestone - requires 50 Mithril + 10 Legendary Gear (no XP)
enhancement_xp_costs.xp_scaling: XP increases by ~50 per level within each 20-level segment. Level 2=2500, level 19=3350, level 21=3500, level 99=9300

empowerment_system.description: At milestone levels (1, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100), Legendary gear requires Mithril and Legendary Gear pieces as 'empowerment' costs in addition to or instead of XP. Between milestones, only Enhancement XP is needed.

reforge.enhancement_reforge: Resets Enhancement Level to 0, refunds 100% of XP and materials
reforge.mastery_reforge: Resets Mastery Level AND Enhancement Level to 0, refunds only 50% of Essence Stones. WARNING: destructive - loses enhancement progress too.

4_mastery_system.question: When does mastery unlock? How does it work?

unlock_requirements.note: All three conditions must be met simultaneously

how_it_works.description: Mastery Forging provides an X% multiplier buff to both the base Gear Strength AND all other buffs provided by that piece of gear. It acts as a percentage-based amplifier on top of the gear's existing stats.

two_phases.levels_1_to_10: Require only Essence Stones (10 per first level, +10 each level: 10, 20, 30...100)
two_phases.levels_11_to_20: Require Essence Stones AND Mythic Hero Gear pieces (110+1, 120+2, ...200+10)

percentage_bonuses_per_level.status: UNKNOWN - No public source provides exact percentage values per mastery level
percentage_bonuses_per_level.what_we_know: The wiki describes it as 'an x% buff' but no source lists the exact x for each level. The percentage is displayed as yellow text on the gear in-game.
percentage_bonuses_per_level.estimation_approach: Would need in-game screenshots at each mastery level to determine exact values

how_it_works.key_threshold: Mastery Level 10 is the minimum required for Legendary Ascension. This is the practical target for most players before the Mythic Gear costs at levels 11-20 become prohibitive.

mastery_for_ascension.note: After ascending to Legendary, mastery is available again on the new Legendary piece, also up to level 20

5_gear_power_and_stats.question: How does gear quality and level translate to actual combat stats?

hero_stats.description: Directly affect the hero character in combat (exploration, arena, etc.)

command_stats.description: Affect the troops under the hero's command. These are percentage-based troop buffs.
command_stats.class_restriction: Command buffs only apply to the troop type matching the gear class

stat_scaling.by_quality: Higher quality gear has higher base stats. Gold gear provides significantly better base stats than Purple or Blue.
stat_scaling.by_enhancement_level: Enhancement levels increase all stats on the gear. XP costs scale from 10 XP at level 1 to 2,400 XP at level 100.
stat_scaling.by_mastery: Mastery Forging applies a percentage multiplier to ALL gear stats (base Gear Strength + all buffs). Available only at Gold quality or higher.
stat_scaling.exact_stat_values: UNKNOWN - No public source provides exact stat values per enhancement level per quality tier. Would require in-game data mining or systematic screenshots.
stat_scaling.confidence: C for exact numbers, A for mechanics

enhancement_xp_per_level.description: XP cost to reach each enhancement level (same across all quality tiers that can be enhanced)
enhancement_xp_per_level.pattern: Levels 1-29: increases by 5 XP per level (10, 15, 20, 25...150). Level 30+: larger, variable increments.

chief_gear_stats.stat_type: Percentage-based Attack and Defense buffs for the associated troop type

bonus_progression.description: Each chief gear tier provides a specific percentage bonus that applies to the troop type's Attack AND Defense

set_bonuses.3_piece: Defense boost for ALL troop types (not just the matched type)
set_bonuses.6_piece: Attack boost for ALL troop types
set_bonuses.note: Set bonuses scale with the lowest tier among equipped pieces

6_gear_slot_mapping.question: Which gear pieces map to which troop types?

chief_gear_slots.description: 6 Chief Gear slots, 2 per troop type. Each piece provides Attack AND Defense buffs for its troop type.

upgrade_priority_reasoning.infantry_first: Infantry engage first in battle, form frontline, need survivability to protect Marksmen behind them
upgrade_priority_reasoning.marksman_second: Primary damage dealers. Their Attack stats directly increase kill rate.
upgrade_priority_reasoning.lancer_last: Less exposed to direct fire, mid-line support, lowest priority for most compositions

hero_gear_slots.description: 4 Hero Gear slots per hero. All gear is class-specific (Infantry hero can only equip Infantry gear, etc.).
hero_gear_slots.class_specificity: All hero gear is troop-type specific. An Infantry hero can ONLY equip Infantry-type hero gear. The game auto-filters compatible options.

exclusive_gear_slot_5.description: 5th slot available only to Legendary (SSR/Gold rarity) heroes at 1-Star Ascension
exclusive_gear_slot_5.upgrade_resource: Hero-specific Widgets (5 per level, 275 total for level 10)
exclusive_gear_slot_5.exclusive_skills: 2 unique skills unlocked at levels 1 and 2

summary_answers.1_quality_progression: Hero gear quality is NOT upgraded in-place. You FIND/OBTAIN gear at each quality level from different sources (exploration, arena, events, shops, packs). Lower quality gear is sacrificed to provide Enhancement XP to your Gold-quality gear. The only true quality 'upgrade' is ascending Gold to Legendary at Enhancement 100 + Mastery 10. Chief gear uses a completely different system: a single continuous tier progression (Green through Pink T3) upgraded step-by-step with materials.
summary_answers.2_level_requirements: Enhancement level 100 is NOT required to 'upgrade quality' in the normal sense, because you don't upgrade quality in-place. The only situation where level 100 matters is: Gold gear must reach Enhancement Level 100 AND Mastery Level 10 before it can be ascended to Legendary. When ascended, the level resets to 0 on the new Legendary piece.
summary_answers.3_legendary_specifics: When Gold gear ascends to Legendary, the enhancement level resets. The new Legendary piece starts at Level 0 and can be enhanced up to Level 100 again. Legendary enhancement has higher XP costs (2,500-9,300 per level) and requires empowerment resources (Mithril + Legendary Gear pieces) at milestone levels 1, 20, 40, 60, 80, 100. Total cost: 502,000 XP + 150 Mithril + 35 Legendary Gear pieces for full Enhancement 100.
summary_answers.4_mastery_system: Mastery Forging unlocks when three conditions are met: Furnace Level 20, gear is Gold quality or higher, AND gear Enhancement Level is at least 20. It provides a percentage multiplier buff to all gear stats. 20 levels total: levels 1-10 need only Essence Stones (550 total), levels 11-20 also need Mythic Gear pieces (55 total). Mastery Level 10 is the critical threshold for Legendary ascension. Exact percentage bonuses per level are unknown (no public source provides them).
summary_answers.5_gear_stats: Hero gear provides two categories of stats: Hero Stats (Attack, Defense, Health for the hero unit itself) and Command Stats (percentage-based troop buffs for the matching troop type: Troop Health, Troop Lethality, Escort Attack/Defense/Health). Slots 1 (Goggles) and 4 (Boots) provide Attack+Lethality buffs. Slots 2 (Gauntlets) and 3 (Belt) provide Defense+Health buffs. Chief gear provides percentage-based Attack AND Defense for its troop type, ranging from 9.35% (Green 0-star) to 187.00% (Pink T3 3-star). Exact stat values per hero gear enhancement level are not publicly documented.
summary_answers.6_slot_mapping: CHIEF GEAR: Coat/Pants = Infantry, Belt/Weapon(Shortstaff) = Marksman, Cap(Hat)/Watch = Lancer. Each provides Attack AND Defense for its troop type. HERO GEAR: 4 slots (Goggles, Gauntlets, Belt, Boots) are class-specific (Infantry hero gets Infantry gear). All 4 slots exist for each troop class. Plus an optional 5th Exclusive Gear slot for Legendary heroes at 1-Star Ascension.

mastery_unlock.actual: Gold quality gear AND Furnace Level 20 AND Enhancement Level 20 minimum. The CLAUDE.md statement is partially correct but omits the Furnace 20 and Enhancement 20 prerequisites.
mastery_unlock.recommendation: Update CLAUDE.md to specify all three prerequisites

quality_naming.claude_md_says: quality (0=None through 6=Legendary), level (0-100), mastery (0-20 for Gold+)
quality_naming.actual: The codebase frontend uses 0=None, 1=Gray, 2=Green, 3=Blue, 4=Purple, 5=Gold, 6=Legendary. The backend engine has 7=Mythic (may be legacy). This mapping is correct in CLAUDE.md.
quality_naming.note: The question asks about Common/Rare/Epic/Legendary/Mythic but these are community names. In-game uses color names: Grey/Green/Blue/Purple/Gold/Legendary(Red).
